Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Aurein 1.2 (natural AMPs; XXA, UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals; BBMm; ZZH)
Sequence Information.Source: Southern bell frogLitoria aureaandLitoria raniformis, Australia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against B. cereus (MIC 100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >100 ug/ml), L. lactis (MIC 12 ug/ml), L. innocua (MIC 100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC  100 ug/ml), P. multocida (MIC  100 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 50 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 50 ug/ml), and S. uberis (MIC 50 ug/ml)(Boland and Separovic, 2006).  Found in multiple species.Structurein D8PG: The reference also reports the NMR structure in 70% TFE.  The 3D structure of aurein 1.2 was also determined in SDS micelles and D8PG (Wang G et al. 2005 J Biol Chem 280: 5803-5811; Go to PDB).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure bound to micellesherein the PDB.  Updated 2/2014; 8/2015; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Rozek T, Wegener KL, Bowie JH, Olver IN, Carver JA, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.2000, Australia
Literature Information.Title: The antibiotic and anticancer active aurein peptides from the australian bell frogs Litoria aurea and Litoria raniformis the solution structure of aurein 1.2.
